        <div class="pageTitle"> 
         <h1 class="syndicate"> Take Steps to Prevent Skin Cancer </h1> 
         <img id="content_contentImage" class="icon-image" alt="" src="/HealthTopics/glmedia/icons/protectyourskinfromthesun.jpg"> 
        </div>

           <div id="the-basics" class="topic_area"> 
            <h2 class="topic_area_title syndicate">The Basics</h2> 
            <div class="pages"> 
             <div class="page" id="page_211"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Overview</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p>The best way to prevent skin cancer is to protect your skin from the sun and other sources of ultraviolet (UV) rays.</p>
               <p>To protect yourself from skin cancer:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Stay in the shade as much as possible between 10 a.m. and 4 p.m.</li>
                <li>Use sunscreen with SPF 15 or higher.</li>
                <li>Cover up with long sleeves, long pants or a long skirt, a hat, and sunglasses.</li>
                <li>Avoid indoor tanning.</li>
                <li>Check your skin for changes regularly.</li>
               </ul>
               <h3>Why do I need to protect my skin?</h3>
               <p>Protecting your skin today may help prevent skin cancer later in life. Most&nbsp;skin cancer appears after age 50, but skin damage from the sun can start during&nbsp;childhood.</p>
               <p>Taking steps to prevent skin cancer may also help prevent:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Wrinkles</li>
                <li>Blotches or spots on your skin</li>
                <li>Other damage to your skin and eyes</li>
               </ul> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_0" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_0" class="button next" href="#the-basics_2">Definition</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_0" class="content_page_range">1 of 6 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_212"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Definition</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <h3>What is skin cancer?</h3>
               <p>Skin cancer is the most common kind of cancer in the United States. There are 3 main types of skin cancer:</p>
               <p></p>
               <ul>
                <li>Basal cell carcinoma</li>
                <li>Squamous cell carcinoma</li>
                <li>Melanoma</li>
               </ul>
               <p>Basal cell carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma are also called nonmelanoma skin cancer, and they are much more common than melanoma. Melanoma is the most dangerous of these cancers.<strong><strong> </strong></strong></p>
               <p>Skin cancer can almost always be cured when its found and treated early. Thats why its a good idea to check your skin regularly for new growths (like moles or lumps) or changes in old growths. Tell your doctor or nurse right away if you find a change.</p>
               <p>Visit these websites to learn more about skin cancer:</p>
               <ul>
                <li><a href="http://www.cancer.gov/types/skin" target="_blank">Skin Cancer</a></li>
                <li><a href="https://www.nia.nih.gov/health/skin-care-and-aging#cancer">Skin Cancer and Aging</a></li>
               </ul> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_1" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_1" class="button next" href="#the-basics_3">Am I at Risk?</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrevLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrev_1" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_1">Overview</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_1" class="content_page_range">2 of 6 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_213"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">The Basics: <span>Am I at Risk?</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <h3>What causes skin cancer?</h3>
               <p>Ultraviolet (UV) radiation from the sun is the main cause of skin cancer. UV radiation can also come from tanning beds, tanning booths, or sunlamps.</p>
               <p>Anyone can get skin cancer. The risk is highest for people with:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Fair (light-colored) skin with freckles</li>
                <li>Blond or red hair</li>
                <li>Blue or green eyes</li>
               </ul>
               <p>You are at increased risk for melanoma, one of the most dangerous types of skin cancer, if you&nbsp;have:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Unusual moles (moles that change color, grow unevenly, or change in texture)</li>
                <li>A large number of moles (more than 50)</li>
                <li>A family history of melanoma or unusual moles</li>
                <li>Fair skin that burns easily</li>
                <li>A personal history of many blistering sunburns, especially when you were a child or teenager</li>
               </ul>
               <p><a href="https://www.cancer.gov/types/skin/moles-fact-sheet" target="_blank">Find out more about unusual moles and melanoma risk</a>. Talk with your doctor or nurse if you are concerned.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_topic_navigation_2" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNextLabel_2" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageNext_2" class="button next" href="#take-action_1">Cover Up</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrevLabel_2" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pagePrev_2" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_2">Definition</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_0_pageRange_2" class="content_page_range">3 of 6 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
            </div> 
            <div class="clear"></div> 
           </div> 
           <div id="take-action" class="topic_area"> 
            <h2 class="topic_area_title syndicate">Take Action!</h2> 
            <div class="pages"> 
             <div class="page" id="page_215"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Cover Up</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <p>Take these simple steps to help prevent skin cancer.</p>
               <h3>Cover up with long sleeves, a hat, and sunglasses.</h3>
               <p>Wear a long-sleeved shirt and long pants or a long skirt when you spend time outdoors. Clothes made from tightly woven fabrics are best for blocking UV rays.&nbsp;</p>
               <p>Wear a hat with a wide brim that protects your face and neck works best. Avoid straw hats with holes that let sunlight through. If you wear a baseball cap or visor, be sure to protect your ears and the back of your neck with sunscreen.</p>
               <p>Wear sunglasses that block UV light. This will help protect your eyes and the skin around them from sun damage. Wrap-around sunglasses are best because they block UV rays from the side.</p>
               <h3>Stay in the shade between 10 a.m. and 4 p.m.</h3>
               <p>The suns rays are the strongest from mid-morning to late afternoon. Try to stay out of the sun during these hours. If you are outside, stay in the shade  like under a tree or umbrella.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_0" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_0" class="button next" href="#take-action_2">Use Sunscreen</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_0" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_0" class="button previous" href="#the-basics_3">Am I at Risk?</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_0" class="content_page_range">4 of 6 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_247"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Use Sunscreen</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <h3>Use sunscreen with SPF 15 or higher.</h3>
               <p>Use sunscreen with both UVA and UVB protection, also called broad spectrum sunscreen. Check the expiration date on the bottle to make sure its not out of date.</p>
               <p>To get the most protection:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>Wear sunscreen even on cloudy days. UV rays can still harm your skin when it's cloudy outside.</li>
                <li>Plan ahead  put sunscreen on 30 minutes before you go outside. Put on more sunscreen every 2 hours and after you swim or sweat.</li>
                <li>Be sure to use enough sunscreen  about a handful. Dont forget to apply it to your ears, hands, feet, the back of your neck, and any part of your scalp that isnt covered by hair.</li>
                <li>Use lip balm with sunscreen in it to protect your lips.</li>
                <li>If you wear very lightweight or loosely woven clothing (like a beach cover-up or thin T-shirt), put sunscreen on under your clothes.</li>
               </ul>
               <p><strong><a href="https://www.fda.gov/drugs/understanding-over-counter-medicines/sunscreen-how-help-protect-your-skin-sun">Learn more about sunscreen</a>.</strong></p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_1" class="topic_navigation clearfix"> 
               <div class="content_page_navigation clearfix"> 
                <span class="content_page_link right"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNextLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Next section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageNext_1" class="button next" href="#take-action_3">Healthy Habits</a> </span> 
                <span class="content_page_link left"> <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrevLabel_1" class="pageHeading">Previous section</span> <a id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pagePrev_1" class="button previous" href="#take-action_1">Cover Up</a> </span> 
                <span id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_pageRange_1" class="content_page_range">5 of 6 sections</span> 
               </div> 
              </div> 
              <!-- /.topic_navigation --> 
             </div> 
             <div class="page" id="page_897"> 
              <h2 class="topic_page_title">Take Action: <span>Healthy Habits</span></h2> 
              <div class="syndicate"> 
               <h3>Avoid indoor tanning.</h3>
               <p>Tanning beds, tanning booths, and sunlamps are not any safer than tanning in the sun. &nbsp;</p>
               <p>Just like tanning in the sun, indoor tanning can cause skin cancer, wrinkles, age spots, and other damage to your skin and eyes.</p>
               <h3><strong>Check your skin regularly.</strong></h3>
               <p>See a doctor or nurse right away if you notice:</p>
               <ul>
                <li>A new growth (like a mole or lump)&nbsp;on your skin</li>
                <li>An existing growth that has changed in size, shape, color, or feel</li>
                <li>A mole that bleeds or a sore that doesnt heal</li>
               </ul>
               <p>Most changes are harmless, but only a doctor or nurse can tell you for sure. <a href="https://www.cancer.org/latest-news/how-to-spot-skin-cancer.html"><strong>Learn more about checking your skin for cancer</strong></a>.</p> 
              </div> 
              <div id="content_tabContentRepeater_areaContentRepeater_1_topic_navigation_2" class="topic_navigation clearfix">
